Freezy-0.0.7: A simple interpreted programming language implemented in Haskell.

Safe HaskellSafe
LanguageHaskell2010

FreezyLang

Description

A Freezy program might look like this:

   fun plus(a, b,) {
       a + b
   }

   # this is a comment :)

   let a = fn (a,b){a+b}(1,4)
   print a # prints 5

   if plus( 2, 5) > 7
       then "wut"
       else "jay"

   let a = 10
   let name = "peter"

   print name
   print a;
   print name ~ a

Semicolon might be ommited Dangling Commas are allowed

Synopsis

  • data TokenType
    • = IDENTIFIER
    • | NUMBER
    • | STRING
    • | TRUE
    • | FALSE
    • | IF
    • | THEN
    • | ELSE
    • | LET
    • | EQUAL
    • | FUN
    • | FN
    • | PRINT
    • | PLUS
    • | MINUS
    • | DASH
    • | STAR
    • | GR_EQ
    • | LE_EQ
    • | GR
    • | LE
    • | EQ_EQ
    • | BANG_EQ
    • | TILDE
    • | BANG
    • | COMMA
    • | SEMICOLON
    • | LPAR
    • | RPAR
    • | LBRACE
    • | RBRACE
    • | EOF
    • | WS
  • data Token = Token {
    • t_type :: TokenType
    • t_lexeme :: String
    • t_line :: Int
    }
  • data Expr
    • = Unary Token Expr
    • | Binary Expr Token Expr
    • | Literal Token
    • | IfExpr Expr Expr Expr
    • | Call Expr [Expr]
    • | Fn [Token] [Expr]
    • | Let Token Expr
    • | Const Token
    • | Grouping Expr
    • | Print Expr
  • type Program = [Expr]
  • type Env = Map String FreezyValue
  • data FreezyValue
    • = Number Integer
    • | String String
    • | Boolean Bool
    • | Function Env [Token] [Expr]

type Program = [Expr] #

A FreezyProgram is just a list of Expressions. This is

  • the output of the main parsing routine
  • the input to the main interpreter

type Env = Map String FreezyValue #

a simple Environment for the Evaluator.

  • this goes here because we store a closure (Env) in Function Values.

data FreezyValue #

Freezy Runtime Values

Constructors
